ratings.comment: Students are expected to watch the lectures before class. During class time, he just asks questions based on the lecture and students answer him. He will not lecture unless you ask him to clarify something. Furthermore, participation is graded so many students end up asking very off topic questions to earn points, making things unproductive.

Sriram is one of the nicest professors I've ever had, he really cares about his students. There are lots of buffer points and exams were open note. He also doesn't get annoyed or flustered with questions in the chat, like some of my other teachers. He was also very receptive to student feed back and made some changes after exam 1.
Great professor on the topic. Very knowledge.

His grading policy is very fair and he does his best to make sure that your grade is not solely based on exam scores. His exams are thorough in making sure you understand content but not impossibly hard if you study and work hard in class. He genuinely cares about feedback from students and does his best to adapt to their needs.

Dr. B is great. Very fair grader on exams & hw. Class is a little atypical - first watch pre class lectures at home online(20mins-1 hr, depends on unit), then go to class and talk over topics from the pre class lecture. 4 exams (drop 1), open note quizzes w/ 3 attempts, few asgmts, and easy opportunity for 5% EC. Dont buy txtbook.

Dr. Boothalingam is passionate about the material he teaches, but also tries his best to help his students understand it. He makes lectures super interactive, giving out extra credit participation points and candy! There is a lot of pre-class work... be sure to do it! That way, lectures will become review sessions, and the concepts stick better.

He is passionate about his field, although his lectures can be kind of disorganized. He posts all of his lectures online before class, thus showing up is kind of useless (but we're graded on participation and attendance so we have to come). That being said, he cares about student success, has easy tests, and always welcomes feedback.

He's one of my favorite professors ever. Really smart and responds to your questions very quickly on piazza. The class has a lot of information to remember, but he offers 10 really easy extra credit points on the tests, and his tests are very manageable in general as he focuses on the most important things. I would be so happy to have him again.

Dr. Boothalingam was an amazing professor who is really passionate about CSD. He really cares for students and even changed his teaching style to fit the students' learning styles. He is also always willing to meet with students for extra help! Abby was also an amazing TA and going to her discussion sections are really helpful! Loved his class!

Professor Boothalingam is one of my favorite I have ever had. The material in this course is tough but totally worth it having him as a professor. He is so passionate about what his career is and it shows! Also an awesome TA!

Professor Boothalingam was my professor for CSD 202 for Spring 2019. I was nervous going in, because of some of the comments, but he was actually really great. He listens to his students and changed up his style because many of the students didn't like it. He's really available via email and even moved the review session room closer to the students

He gives very confusing and overwhelming lectures. It is never clear what content you are expected to know for the exams. The review for the final was posted only 3 days before the exam and was 57 pages! He sometimes has a condescending attitude during conversations as well as giving minimal assistance when contacted for help. Do not reccomend

Prof Boothalingam's lectures are jam packed with an incredible amount of information and you're supposed to retain every ounce of what he says. The slides don't have a good flow, and it's really REALLY easy to get lost quickly and forget where you started and where you're going. The book's mostly unhelpful. That said he's responsive to feedback.

Dr. Boothalingam is extremely smart but is not the best professor. His lectures can sometimes be confusing and boring. However there are many opportunities for help and he really listens to the students concerns. Overall he is a fair teacher but can be hard.
Dr. Boothalingam is a great professor and really knows his stuff! He also offers a ton of extra credit and is super available outside of class. His tests can be hard, but they're never too crazy.
